Sequence Information.Peptide Name: DASamP2 (synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich; variant of polybia-MPI, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, insects, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is poorly similar (78.57%) toPolybia-MPI. K: 29%. GRAVY: -0.107; M Wt: 1737.242;  M formula: C83H150N25O15; mol ex coeff: 5550. A peptide mutant of polybia-MPI with the following mutations: D2K, D8R, and Q12R.Chemical modification:  C-termnal amidation.Activity: active against S. aureus USA300 MRSA (MIC 6.2 uM), E. coli (MIC 3.1 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 12.5 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 6.25 uM).Toxicity: hemolytic HC50 75 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Menousek J, Mishra B, Hanke ML, Heim CE, Kielian T, Wang G. 2012
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Antimicrob Agents. 2012 May;39(5):402-6. doi: 10.1016/j.ijantimicag.2012.02.003.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Database screening and in vivo efficacy of antimicrobial peptides against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus USA300
